Unlike U.S. banking subsidiaries that are regulated by U.S. authorities such as the Federal Reserve and FDIC, BNY SA/NV is authorized and regulated as a credit institution by the European Central Bank and the National Bank of Belgium under the Single Supervisory Mechanism, and also supervised by the Belgian Financial Services and Markets Authority for conduct of business rules.

Unlike the U.S. banking subsidiaries, which are regulated by U.S. agencies (OCC, FDIC, Federal Reserve) under U.S. capital, liquidity and consumer‑protection rules, BNY SA/NV is governed by the European Central Bank’s Single Supervisory Mechanism and the National Bank of Belgium (plus the Belgian Financial Services and Markets Authority), operating under EU banking law and the Single Supervisory Mechanism rather than U.S. banking statutes.

(4) Demonstrates sound multi-hop reasoning by synthesizing information about both operational role and regulatory structure across multiple jurisdictions. When the company licenses that content to its cable, broadcast or Peacock platforms, the license fees are also capitalized as “licensed content” and amortized over the period the titles are available for use, so the expense recognized reflects the consumption of the content on its owned television networks and digital properties.
